info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 1:59PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, in northwest Colorado, Garfield. In west central Colorado, Mesa. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.6 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... West Salt Creek - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Garfield and Northwestern Mesa Counties along West Salt Creek
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
